title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  L'Écrevisse [Crayfish],  from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service", 1824
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, pink/tan watercolor, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink over graphite, on mount above drawing:  L'écrevisse, below drawing:  que fais tu ici?--ma tante qui viens tu faire? [What are you doing here auntie--what are you coming to do?]; in graphite, upper right corner of mount:  6
description: Scene at a seafood restaurant whose sign is posted in the doorway: " à l'ecrevisse/ et sa fille." An other coubple, right foreground, stand at the restaurant entrance.  He smokes a pipe, she stands with her left hand on her hip and gestures to a  young, well-dressed couple seated outside the restaurant at a table beneath an arbor.  The young woman is taken by surprise when she sees her aunt and exclaims, "What are you doing here autie--what are you coming to do?"

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  L'Écrevisse [Crayfish],  from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service", 1824. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown/black wash, white gouache, red crayon, pink/tan watercolor, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and brown ink. 1989-13-40.
